title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of current Greater Boston news.
The quiz includes topics such as recent blizzards and local retail developments.
Peter Chianca is Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.

title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro, called up from Providence, played in net for six minutes during the Bruins' 4-2 win.
Joonas Korpisalo was briefly pulled due to a concussion protocol after a collision with a Blue Jackets player.
Head coach Marco Sturm rested Jeremy Swayman post-Olympics, allowing DiPietro a brief appearance against Columbus.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, charged with reckless second-degree murder over her infant's death in Manchester, N.H.
Infant known as 'Baby Jane Doe' found dead in Pine Island Pond on March 27, 2025.
Police received 50 leads and increased reward to $5,000; investigation remains active.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner was advised to perform another drain and refill after black transmission fluid was found.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek recommended service included replacing all four tire pressure sensors and control arm bushings inspection.
A 2018 GMC Denali owner was advised that low antifreeze levels are likely due to evaporation, not leaks.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham evacuated due to snow-induced structural stress on the roof.
Students and staff were relocated to Hingham High School as a precaution, with lunch and transport home arranged.
Hingham reported over 17 inches of snow from Monday's blizzard, leading to roof stress concerns.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz changes his perspective on Rafael Devers after previously criticizing him for his performance and attitude.
Ortiz now expresses love and respect for Devers, calling him a great player and wishing him success with the Giants.
Devers was traded to the Giants in 2025 after a fractured relationship with the Red Sox over positional disagreements.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A gas leak caused an explosion in Taunton, destroying a home and seriously injuring a mother and her daughter.
The explosion displaced eight residents and damaged neighboring homes; the exact cause of ignition is under investigation.
Community fundraisers for the affected families have raised over $53,000, with widespread local support reported.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots ranked 26th in the NFLPA 2026 report card, improving from 31st place the previous year.
Key issues include poor travel resources and low scores for food quality, with the team plane ranking last in the league.
Patriots ownership rises from a D to B-, but still ranks in the bottom 10 for investment in team facilities.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden teacher Scott Marino, 54, arraigned on charges including two counts of rape, involving an 18-year-old foster child.
Prosecutors allege Marino gave the victim alcohol before assaulting her; she was his foster child, coached by him in basketball.
Marino released on $75,000 bail, ordered under GPS monitoring; next court hearing set for April 16.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assault and battery in Springfield for January traffic stop incident.
Daoust allegedly used physical force and pepper spray on driver, suspended by State Police.
Daoust, previously disciplined in 2015 and 2017, faces arraignment on April 3.
